Articles.Content:
TARDIS V2

Oh yes, It can be flown! seperate engine, fuel, sas and pod. even custom wheezing donkey sound (although it suffers like all engine sounds do at present - if it starts to crackle, throttle off and back on). Flew to the moon and landed no problem.

Prebuilt ship included but its about as difficult as lego to put together!

Polygon count was dropped from 6500+ to about 600 all in!

Here it is for download!

http://www./?ylxy8jb9o2p5ibw

I can\'t wait to get back from work to try it.

To Gallifrey !!
EXTERMINATE, EXTERMINATE, EXTERMINATE, EXTERMINATE.

EXTERMINATE, EXTERMINATE, EXTERMINATE, EXTERMINATE.

This would have been better for the topic where someone made the Dalek.

This would have been better for the topic where someone made the Dalek.

Hehehehe

Looks awesome xD

only one wee question, any chance you could make the download a .zip as well as the .rar?

Hehehehe

UPGRADING IS COMPULSURY.

UPGRADE OR YOU WILL BE DELETED.

I love this, but I don\'t like how it comes apart unless I come straight down on final approach. Any kind of lateral movement (which appears to be unavoidable) causes the engine to break off the fuel tank. The tank then flips upside down and the pod snaps off during the roll. Nothing explodes, but I was under the impression that a Type-40 TT capsule was sturdier than that.

I love this, but I don\'t like how it comes apart unless I come straight down on final approach. Any kind of lateral movement (which appears to be unavoidable) causes the engine to break off the fuel tank. The tank then flips upside down and the pod snaps off during the roll. Nothing explodes, but I was under the impression that a Type-40 TT capsule was sturdier than that.

Just tried this, maybe its the version of software (im on 12x4 at the mo). I took her up, fired across and renentered at about 2900m/s sideways. no damage. in fact the only damage I suffered was when it twatted into the deck! Any minor twisting or lateral when landing either just throws the ship over when it digs into the ground or rips the ship apart because it was too fast anyway. I\'m not seeing what you are describing.

First, THANK YOU! Excellent job on the Old Girl. Second... Put her into LKO, set time-warp to 1000x, came back an hour or two later and KSP had crashed with a GC error: Too many heap sections. I believe it to be related to the TARDIS as I\'ve never experienced a crash in the game before other than the 'freeze' (orbital calculation bug) in 12x1 -12x4. Don\'t care where the problem is, I\'m going to fly the TARDIS anyway... Just wanted to let you know there *may* be a potential issue with your mod.

Thanks again! Lovin it!
Attached are screens of said breakage, and this was AFTER I cranked up collision into the thousands for each part...

First, THANK YOU! Excellent job on the Old Girl. Second... Put her into LKO, set time-warp to 1000x, came back an hour or two later and KSP had crashed with a GC error: Too many heap sections. I believe it to be related to the TARDIS as I\'ve never experienced a crash in the game before other than the 'freeze' (orbital calculation bug) in 12x1 -12x4. Don\'t care where the problem is, I\'m going to fly the TARDIS anyway... Just wanted to let you know there *may* be a potential issue with your mod.

Thanks again! Lovin it!

That\'s a known bug in all versions with all types of ships. Low enough orbit that the terrain displays results in heap section errors at high warp.

That\'s a known bug in all versions with all types of ships. Low enough orbit that the terrain displays results in heap section errors at high warp.

Is ~200,000m 'low enough' for the terrain to still be displaying? I normally orbit just above 600,000m so that may be why I\'ve never seen this, but in the beginning, I was orbiting in the 100\'s and never crashed either. With the exception of 12x2 - 12x5 I\'ve never had an issue... Maybe because I run the game on Linux, WINE is protecting me a little from crashes.

What is considered 'LKO'? I may have used the term too loosely, and I was at time warp 100, not 1,000, typo there...

I do get real choppy orbiting the Mun below 1,000m but never stayed long enough to see a crash...

None of it changes the fact I love the game AND the TARDIS, AND your mod packs Nova, thanks for those BTW.
This is awesome! Now, when choosing crew is implemented, you HAVE to make a mod where Jeb, Bill, and Bob wear tophats and monacles.

This is awesome! Now, when choosing crew is implemented, you HAVE to make a mod where Jeb, Bill, and Bob wear tophats and monacles.

YES

I want a video before I try it!

Seriously, though, please make a video. 8)

DAVID TENNANT AL THE WAY

DAVID TENNANT ALL THE WAY

ACROSS THE SKY!
Bow ties are cool, too!

Hmm, does this not work with .13.1? I unzip it, see the tardis in the craft folder, and the parts in the parts folder, but when I try to load it it says the craft is missing parts... Is there any chance of an upgraded version?

Oh, and about the crew, when we get it: Eccleston, Tennant and Smith?

Open the .craft file that you\'re given from the download, look for where it says 'version = 0.12.0' and change it to 0.13.1.

Alternatively, it is simple to rebuild with four pieces.
Cool, that got it working. Unfortunately, as soon as i hit 'space', the engine breaks off, so I can\'t fly it. Any ideas on how to fix that?

Just load it into the VAB and select the engine.

Take it off and put it back on.

Save it and now it works again.

Cool, that got it working. Unfortunately, as soon as i hit 'space', the engine breaks off, so I can\'t fly it. Any ideas on how to fix that?

My guess would be the throttle is too high. Try a lower throttle setting to exert less force on the TARDIS.
Seems like replacing the engine worked! Thanks.
I crashed into the moon with it and died! Hell yeah!!
